intro: Lepidagathis javanica, commonly known as the Java lepidagathis, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in summer. It is often cultivated as a ground cover due to its dense foliage and ornamental value. Lepidagathis javanica is also valued in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
